meanings.definition: A bishop assisting a diocesan bishop.
meanings.sent1: The suffragans supported the diocesan bishop in his duties.
meanings.sent2: The suffragans were responsible for helping the main bishop.
meanings.sent3: The suffragans and the diocesan bishop formed a strong team.
meanings.sent4: The suffragans were like the right-hand people of the diocesan bishop.
meanings.sent5: The suffragans were crucial assistants to the diocesan bishop.

meanings.sent1: The suffragans were respected leaders in the church.
meanings.sent2: The suffragans had their own areas of responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The suffragans had a friendly competition among themselves.
meanings.sent4: The suffragans were like mini-bishops within the church.
meanings.sent5: The suffragans were important figures in the church hierarchy.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of a suffragan.
meanings.sent1: The suffragans' influence was felt throughout the diocese.
meanings.sent2: The suffragans' role was crucial in the bishop's work.
meanings.sent3: The suffragans' attire was always elegant and dignified.
meanings.sent4: The suffragans' presence added a sense of unity to the church.
meanings.sent5: The suffragans' responsibilities were diverse and important.
